most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?

Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Authentication and Account Linking Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty authenticating and linking accounts, primarily Google and GitHub, across Windows and Linux. Problems include infinite loading loops during login, single account linking limitations, and HTTP 500 errors. Solutions involve investigating logs, implementing fixes, and exploring manual account merging.  A new account linking system is under development.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User johnkennyuk is having trouble linking their Github and Google accounts in Pieces.
* The current account linking flow is not working properly and is being replaced.
* User's email addresses have a capitalization difference, which may be causing the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* Account linking flow is not working.
* User's email addresses have a capitalization difference.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark, a Pieces support member, offered to manually merge the accounts.
* User's Github account was reset multiple times.
* User was advised to wait for the new account linking system.
* New account linking system is now available and user was able to link their accounts successfully.
* User accidentally linked accounts in the wrong order and needs them reset.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User's accounts are linked in the wrong order.
* Mark offered to schedule a time to help the user resolve the issue.

**Additional Notes:**

* The new account linking system is still in development and may have some bugs.
* It is not possible to reset account data server-side or client-side.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Users are unable to link their Google account after the update to Pieces OS version 11.3.0.
* The issue occurs after logging out and attempting to log in again.
* Authentication attempts through the Pieces toolbar or the desktop app result in an infinite loading loop at https://authentication.pieces.services/.

**Problems identified:**

* Bug in the authentication flow introduced in the latest Pieces OS update.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggests logging in via the Pieces toolbar's "Connect Account" button.
* Sharing screen recordings helps developers pinpoint the issue.
* Investigating logs identifies the cause of the problem.
* Fix is implemented and deployed within a few hours.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Authentication issue resolved.
* Users can successfully link their Google accounts.

**Additional notes:**

* Some users may need to check the support logs for confirmation.
* Issue closed, but may be reopened if further problems arise.

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @utrack is experiencing authentication issues on Linux and has provided a link to their calendar for real-time debugging.
* They would like instructions on how to enable debug logs.
* They are using Arch Linux rolling.

**Problems Identified:**

* User is unable to authenticate properly on Linux.
* Logs provided are not very helpful.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @nathan-courtney-pieces requested the user's entire log file and information about their Linux distribution.
* User provided log files and confirmed they are using Arch Linux rolling.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is still open and under investigation.
* No solutions have been implemented yet.


**Additional Notes:**

* The user has not provided their full log file as requested.
* The provided log files do not contain enough information to diagnose the issue.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS/Desktop App Installation and Startup Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing "Invalid Port," database corruption, and login errors on Windows and Linux. Workarounds include reinstalling with admin rights (Windows) and updating to the latest version (11.3.2 or higher).  The Pieces team is actively investigating and providing support.  Detailed logs are crucial for troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Problem:**

* Users are encountering an "Invalid Port" error when launching Pieces Desktop.
* The root cause is likely the Pieces Desktop installer not requesting admin rights, leading to issues binding to a local port.

**Key Points:**

* This issue has been triaged and routed to the appropriate team member.
* Affected users are seeing the error "Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect."
* Multiple users are facing this problem.
* The problem seems to be specific to Windows users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Install both PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop app using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session.
* This grants the installer admin rights, allowing it to configure the local server correctly.
* The Pieces team is working on adjusting installation methods to reflect this requirement.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The workaround provided by a user (zedevmed) has been confirmed as effective.
* The Pieces team is actively working on a permanent solution and updating documentation to reflect the recommended installation method.

**Additional Notes:**

* The Pieces team is requesting affected users to provide additional information and participate in troubleshooting calls.
* The issue seems to be specific to Windows installations and potentially specific to certain Windows versions or configurations.

**Action Items:**

* Affected users can try the workaround mentioned above.
* Participate in troubleshooting calls with the Pieces team if requested.
* Keep an eye on the GitHub issue for updates on a permanent solution.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The latest version doesn't start. 

Here is the log in com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs:

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting OS_Server!
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting EnvConf

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Branch: 11.3.0
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  SHA1: a59a1f114c021e83a6f42e696223dba9a670faa2

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Channel : production
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Process ID: 2076
[D]  Setting Url Protocol Scheme for Inno Setup/ Squirrel Installs
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.625235  Logging to file: C:\Users\antoine\Documents\com.pieces.os\production\Support/logs/log-04122025.txt
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Copying the vocab file to the data directory
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Successfully copied the vocab file
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Starting OS
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.660235  Starting OS
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.660235  Starting UI
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  UI#builder, hasData: false, hasError: false
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  stateStream#onListen
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#boot
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#attach
[38;5;12m[I][0m  initializeDataSingletons
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.991237  Created our Tagify Files Locally.
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.991237  User added tagify files now exist.
[D]  Setting WinToast Dismissed Callback
[D]  Setting WinToast Dismissed Callback
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 1ba7ab308a4b470ab996b360cc956398
[38;5;12m[I][0m  _controller.addError Unable to open database due to corruption LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #0      InternalCouchBaseDatabases.initializeCouchbase (package:database_facade/couchbase/singletons/internal_databases.dart)
<asynchronous suspension>
#1      OS.initializeDataSingletons (package:os_server/os.dart:909)
<asynchronous suspension>
#2      OS.boot (package:os_server/os.dart:652)
<asynchronous suspension>
#3      OS._controller.<anonymous closure>.<anonymous closure>.<anonymous closure> (package:os_server/os.dart:275)
<asynchronous suspension>

[D]  Sentry Error Event: 2a48d07355694369b880fa84ef743112
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 9f79ad8b81a1493c955f24b3cf97db7e
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:05.956756  UI#builder, hasData: false, hasError: true
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:

**Key points:**

* User reported an issue with the initial bootup of their database.
* The user tried deleting the database folder and reinstalling the software, but the problem persisted.
* With the user's help, the developer diagnosed the issue as the software requiring AVX2 support, which the user's CPU does not have.

**Problems identified:**

* Database corruption.
* Software requiring AVX2 support, which the user's CPU does not have.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Developer provided logging for debugging.
* Developer is releasing a fix (version 11.3.2) to account for CPUs without AVX2 support.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Fix is released in version 11.3.2.
* Issue is considered resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user's detailed logs were crucial in identifying the root cause of the problem.
* The developer was responsive and provided timely updates.

**Action Items:**

* Users experiencing similar issues should update to version 11.3.2 of the software.
* If the problem persists, users can contact Pieces support.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Crash/Startup Failure Due to Database Corruption
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported Pieces OS crashing or failing to start on macOS and Windows due to database corruption.  Error messages include "Unexpected error occurred" and "LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized."  Suggested solutions include checking for similar issues, updating to the latest version (11.3.2 or later), and reviewing logs.  Plugin integration and AVX2 CPU support may also be factors.

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** 
Moazzem reported an app crash issue after updating to version 10.9.6 on macOS 12.3 with M2 chip. They provided crash logs and expected the app to launch without crashing.

**Key points:**
- User reported crashing issue after update
- Provided OS, hardware and plugin information
- Attached logs and described expected behavior
- Support team member suspected a known issue

**Solutions:**
- Support team suggested checking a similar issue (#686)
- Recommended scheduling support call if the issue persists

**Outcome:**
- The latest update (11.3.2) was suggested as a possible fix.
- User was instructed to reopen the issue if the problem persists after updating.

**Current Status:** 
Open, pending confirmation from the user if the update resolves the issue.

**Key points:**

* User reported an issue with the initial bootup of their database.
* The user tried deleting the database folder and reinstalling the software, but the problem persisted.
* With the user's help, the developer diagnosed the issue as the software requiring AVX2 support, which the user's CPU does not have.

**Problems identified:**

* Database corruption.
* Software requiring AVX2 support, which the user's CPU does not have.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Developer provided logging for debugging.
* Developer is releasing a fix (version 11.3.2) to account for CPUs without AVX2 support.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Fix is released in version 11.3.2.
* Issue is considered resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user's detailed logs were crucial in identifying the root cause of the problem.
* The developer was responsive and provided timely updates.

**Action Items:**

* Users experiencing similar issues should update to version 11.3.2 of the software.
* If the problem persists, users can contact Pieces support.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* moazzem-pixel reported an issue with Pieces OS not starting due to database corruption.
* The issue was automatically triaged by the pieces-support-bot.
* The bot suggested related issues and helpful resources.
* mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of another reported problem.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces OS fails to open due to database corruption.
* This is a potential duplicate of another reported issue.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The user is directed to the related issue for further discussion.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The original issue is closed as a duplicate.
* Users are encouraged to continue the conversation on the related issue thread.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving authentication issues impacting Windows and Linux users, focusing on account linking and HTTP 500 errors.
Address Pieces OS and Desktop App installation and startup problems, including "Invalid Port" errors, database corruption, and login failures on Windows and Linux.
Investigate and fix the root cause of database corruption leading to Pieces OS crashes and startup failures across macOS and Windows.
Improve installation guides with clear instructions for admin rights (Windows) and troubleshooting database issues.
Develop more robust account linking system and ensure seamless integration across different platforms.
Proactively monitor and address database health, implementing preventative measures against corruption.
Provide clear communication and updates to users regarding ongoing issues and their resolutions.
Collect detailed logs and system information to aid in faster troubleshooting and resolution of user problems.
Consider implementing automated tests to catch issues like invalid ports and database corruption earlier in the development cycle.
Prioritize issues based on frequency and activity level, focusing on those with the highest impact on users, such as authentication and startup problems.
